citation.article-title: Sedimenticola selenatireducens, gen. nov., sp. nov., an anaerobic selenate-respiring bacterium isolated from estuarine sediment

p.s: Sedimenticola Se.di.men.ti’ co.la. L. neut. n. sedimentum sediment, L. masc./fem. Suffix n. -cola dweller, inhabitant, N.L. masc. n. Sedimenticola, sediment dweller
Gram-negative, non-motile, rod-shaped cells about 1.5 μm long and 0.5 μm wide.
Grows in minimal salts medium using selenium or nitrogen oxyanions as electron acceptor.
Phylogenetically, it is a member of the Gammaproteobacteria.
The type species is S. selenatireducens.
